intro: Ardisia miaoliensis, commonly known as the Miaoli ardisia, is a flowering plant species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Myaceae and is characterized by its evergreen leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are an important food source for various bird species. Ardisia miaoliensis typically grows in moist, shaded forest environments, often in mountainous regions. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
